channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CASSANDRA-11523] server side exception on secondary index query through thrift
item.description:
Trying to upgrade from 2.x to 3.x, using 3.0.4 for the purpose. We are using thrift interface for the time being. Everything works fine except for secondary index queries.

When doing a get_range_slices call with row_filter set in the KeyRange we get a server side exception. Here is a trace of the exception:

The row_filter has 2 EQ IndexExpressions in it, nothing fancy. Let me know if more information is needed.
item.summary: server side exception on secondary index query through thrift

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The problem is that when the indexed column is not covered by the Thrift query's slice_predicate it isn't included in the data retrieved from the base table using the key obtained from the index lookup. The NPE is coming from the staleness check which expects that data to be present in the base table, it only affects thrift queries, not CQL queries against the same table.

I've pushed branches off 3.0 & trunk with a simple fix to KeysSearcher which essentially mimics the pre-2.2 behaviour, which used ExtendedFilter to add any columns required for the read to the filter before pruning them from the results returned to the user.

yngwiie, this patch applies cleanly to 3.0.4. If possible, would you mind applying it and checking that it works for you?

Pull request to add a new dtest for this issue is here

branch testall dtest
11523-3.0 testall dtest
11523-trunk testall dtest
Thanks, committed to 3.0 in 14f08e6f66ef96614fccd12d1eac482c00ee7dc5 & merged to trunk
Tested with 3.0.10. No exception, however the query returns no results, where a result is expected.
